data.title: Can't build on Ubuntu 13.10 "/usr/bin/env: node: No such file or directory"
data.body:
This is my first time building anything from source. When I run  "script/build" after downloading the repo I get "/usr/bin/env: node: No such file or directory". I am using Ubuntu 13.10 and following the guide at https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/linux.md.
How can I fix this?

data.title: `AutoUpdater is not defined`
data.body:
This morning I just try to use Atom from cli like everyday.
And got:

```
Cannot locate Atom.app, it is usually located in /Applications. Set the ATOM_PATH environment variable to the directory containing Atom.app.
```

So I just take a look and see

![screen shot 2014-05-14 at 10 48 36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/157534/2968738/9262c978-db44-11e3-820d-cfe1e73ed043.png)

When I try to hit that, I got a dialog with

```
ReferenceError: AutoUpdater is not defined
  at EventEmitter.autoUpdater.quitAndInstall (/opt/homebrew-cask/Caskroom/atom/latest/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/api/lib/auto-updater.js:32:35)
  at AutoUpdateManager.module.exports.AutoUpdateManager.install (/opt/homebrew-cask/Caskroom/atom/latest/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/browser/auto-update-manager.js:109:26)
```

It happens after copy&paste from PDF (word with `й`)

data.title: Please consider adding an API in Atom that allows for interception of  the window creation process.
data.body:
After hacking on Atom for the past week, I was able to simulate custom client-side window decorations (ala GNOME) and was hoping I could propose an official api.

My proof of concept is here (the hack was quick and dirty): https://github.com/nikolowry/atom-csd. 

The api could possibly detect if a global menu is present (Mac, Unity, Mate, etc), which would then ensure the original menu api functions as expected. However in OS's/DEs that don't use global menu's (Fedora, Ubuntu GNOME, WIndows, etc) it would both detach the menu and serve a frameless window.

Another idea could be to place some optional settings/flags in the api that would make the end-user ultimately responsible for choosing if they want a frameless window/detached menu or only the frameless window.

I have no qualms with writing a clean/modular/logical solution and issuing a pull request when I'm finished, but would only start with the blessings of the atom team.

Before writing this request for consideration, I made sure to check if it was possible to intercept window creation at run-time in the atom-shell and was informed it was not: https://github.com/atom/atom-shell/issues/302

I know how difficult it is to optimize cross-platform and to propose custom/experimental designs/solutions in a corporate setting (regardless of whether said organization is horizontally or vertically integrated), and appreciate your consideration either way.

If we could implement this, Atom would surely become the "champion editor" for us developers that prefer to run a non-traditional-OS/DE.

Your support for either a full blown "offical window theme api" w default styles (ala the ui/syntax manager) or just a simple api intended exclusively for package developers, would be amazing.

data.title: Hide the cursor with cursor-hidden class rather than element.style
data.body:
Implements @bhuga's suggestion here: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2204

Allows packages to override the default hiding of the cursor when selecting text.

data.title: Detects python2 in $PATH at build time, fixes #2211
Fails to build due to Python 3 being /usr/bin/python
data.body:
The [build instructions](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/linux.md) say to do `npm config set python /usr/bin/python2 -g` — and so I did, yet I still couldn’t build Atom.  I had to do `PYTHON=/usr/bin/python2 script/build` to bypass this.

Arch Linux x86_64.

_Also, bonus bit of pedantry: doesn’t build if CC/CXX = clang. That’s a non-issue, though._

**ninja edit:** misspelled `python2` in `PYTHON=…`

data.title: No OSX menu highlight on keyboard shortcuts
data.body:
When using keyboard shortcuts the corresponding menu in the menu bar does not highlight. Pretty minor detail but inconsistent with other OSX applications.

For example when pressing command+s for save, the "File" menu should flash blue as feedback that a keyboard shortcut was pressed from that menu.

data.title: Touchscreen support (with high DPI)
data.body:
I have a Microsoft Service tablet and I tried Atom on it. With mouse it works like a charm but when I use the touch screen it doesn't work that well. I think it is something like 100 pixels wrong on the  x-ax and 60 on the y-ax. So the cursor moves 100px more to the left and 60 to the top.
Note: I do have DPI scaling enabled at 150% after changing it to 100% (and logging out) it did work

Note: The menus do work correctly with touch, just the editor (and tabs don't)

I do not know if it is Windows specific because I don't have another OS with touchscreen.

Edit: I changed the issue I didn't logout the first time so my DPI settings didn't change.

data.title: Double clicking a word doesn't select the entire word
data.body:
#### Atom Version

Built from source at c77a6b1
#### Steps:
1. Create a new editor
2. Paste `supercalifragilisticexpialidocious`
3. Double click supercalifragilisticexpialidocious
#### Result:

The entire word isn't selected, only a portion of it is

data.title: Preview mode
data.body: This replicates Sublime Text's semi-transient editor.  It the user enables Preview Mode in settings (disabled by default) they can then quickly open files with a new open closing the last one unless they edit or save the file.  Then the editor leaves preview mode and is permeant in the workspace until the user closes the tab.  Please let me know anything I'm missing.

data.title: Should we hide the cursor whenever we make a selection?
data.body:
I'm trying to update vim-mode to allow this behavior (gif using regular vim):

![visible](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1029110/2955133/4e950ff8-da7c-11e3-8610-2978ef94d30f.gif)

This doesn't work because of this line:

https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/cursor.coffee#L23

Which explicitly implements hiding the cursor if the selection is not empty:

https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/cursor.coffee#L103

cc/ @bhuga

data.title: Build script ignoring url.insteadof from .gitconfig
data.body:
I'm following the instructions from #2014 to build on Fedora 20. I am behind a firewall that blocks git URLs so I added the following to my .gitconfig

```
[url "https://github.com/"]
        insteadOf = git://github.com/
```

However I get the following error when building

```
npm ERR! git clone git://github.com/atom/slick.git Cloning into bare repository '/home/mark/.atom/.node-gyp/.atom/.apm/_git-remotes/git-github-com-atom-slick-git-fe3034e1'...
npm ERR! git clone git://github.com/atom/slick.git fatal: unable to connect to github.com:
npm ERR! git clone git://github.com/atom/slick.git github.com[0: 192.30.252.130]: errno=Connection timed out
npm ERR! Error: Command failed: Cloning into bare repository '/home/mark/.atom/.node-gyp/.atom/.apm/_git-remotes/git-github-com-atom-slick-git-fe3034e1'...
npm ERR! fatal: unable to connect to github.com:
npm ERR! github.com[0: 192.30.252.130]: errno=Connection timed out
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! 
npm ERR!     at ChildProcess.exithandler (child_process.js:637:15)
npm ERR!     at ChildProcess.EventEmitter.emit (events.js:98:17)
npm ERR!     at maybeClose (child_process.js:743:16)
npm ERR!     at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:810:5)
npm ERR! If you need help, you may report this *entire* log,
npm ERR! including the npm and node versions, at:
npm ERR!     <http://github.com/npm/npm/issues>

```

It is as if the .gitconfig setting is being ignored.

data.title: Packages can override vital keyboard shorcuts like copy/paste
data.body:
Hi,
I can see that copy shortcut key in linux has the same as another package for script. 

``` cson
'.editor':
  'ctrl-c': 'script:kill-process'
```

I think core shortcut keys must not be overridden by the package script in any situation.

data.title: Move .atom config to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME on linux
data.body:
From feedesktop.org:

$XDG_CONFIG_HOME defines the base directory relative to which user specific configuration files should be stored. If $XDG_CONFIG_HOME is either not set or empty, a default equal to $HOME/.config should be used.

Source: http://standards.freedesktop.org/basedir-spec/basedir-spec-latest.html

Thanks!

data.title: Add more Emoji to the contributing guide
data.body:
Suggested Emoji for:
- Fixing something on Mac OS
- Fixing a bug
- Burning whitespace
- Fixing the CI build
- Adding tests
- Refactoring
- Security

data.title: Multiple Column Selection
data.body:
In Sublime, I have this config:

``` json
[
  { "keys": ["alt+shift+up"], "command": "select_lines", "args": {"forward": false} },
  { "keys": ["alt+shift+down"], "command": "select_lines", "args": {"forward": true} }
]
```

This lets me to do things like select multiple curly brackets on different rows and shift align them altogether. 

Is there a way to do this in Atom.io? I did some searching but wasn't able to find it.

![image](http://i.imgur.com/5CKufuV.gif)

data.title: Grammar/language/syntax label is stuck
data.body:
The grammar label at the bottom left of the editor window stuck to "Plain Text" as of 3f0640f4c3, as shown in this WebM: https://www.pellero.it/atom2.webm
Switching file fixes the issue, though.

data.title: Multiple Atom entries in "Open With" context menu
data.body:
Using the Mac's Finder, if I right click on a file (e.g. a css file) and select "Open With" There will be multiple duplicated Atom entries in the list. See attached screenshot.

![atom-context-menu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/89930/2946669/d8ea7ac4-d9ed-11e3-9769-21edca279ab4.png)

data.title: Upgrade to atom-shell@0.12.4
data.body:
Changelog:
- Fix emitting unresposive event too early when closing window
- Fix crash when closing a crashed window

**Linux**
- Fix disappearing menubar (fixes #1961, fixes #2007)
- Ship system dynamic libraries (fixes #1955)
